info.prompt: You are a data miner that deals with scientific texts on microbiology and you extract numerical values related with antimicrobial effect. For the text I will input next, output only the numbers associated with percentage values related to an biofilm eradication or disruption. Output the percentage symbol with a blank space after each number found (Ex: '10.1 %'). If no percentage is found, output 'None'. Do not output percentage values not related with antibiofilm effect.

('ATC01497', 0).text: Moreover, the synthesized RGO-NiO nanocomposite exhibited antibiofilm activity (following 10.0 ug mL-1 RGO-NiO), with an inhibition percentage of 94.60 % for B. subtilis, 91.74 % for P. aeruginosa, and 98.03 % for C. neoformans.

('ATC01726', 0).text: In vitro results show that treatment with MPA NSs under near-infrared (NIR) laser irradiation can efficiently eradicate the established S. aureus biofilms with 99.99 % of the bacteria inside biofilms killed, which shows significantly enhanced therapeutic efficacy compared with the MPA only group or the NIR laser irradiation only group.

('ATC04272', 0).text: Replicative viability experiments revealed that >= 99 % of cells from each type of biofilm were killed via NO release, with the greatest efficacy (>= 99.999 % killing) against gram-negative P. aeruginosa and E. coli biofilms.

('ATC05562', 0).text: Under subinhibitory concentration (3.1 mg ml-1 it was found a reduction of microbial adhesion and exopolysaccharide dosages in respectively 83.3 % and 75 % of the bacterial samples.

('ATC06754', 0).text: Besides that, results were confirmed using confocal laser scanning microscopy (CLSM), which showed a decrease in the number of living cells to 80 % and 60 % for MBEC and MBIC, respectively, for all the clinical bacterial strains.

('ATC06866', 1).text: At this concentration, PEINF equally inhibited biofilm formations of E. coli (90.48 +/- 2.05 %), S. aureus (87.04 +/- 1.59 %) and C. albicans (90.94 +/- 1.03 %).

('ATC07274', 1).text: Mixing Soluplus-based micelles with Solutol further enhanced the CHX penetration (71 %) and promoted maximum reduction in biofilm biomass ( > 60 %).

('ATC10390', 0).text: The results revealed improved biofilm inhibition, exopolysaccharide inhibition, and reduced cell viability in test bacteria treated with MGCNT conjugate. P. aeruginosa and S. aureus biofilms were considerably reduced to 60.20 +/- 2.48 % and 67.59 +/- 3.53 %, respectively.

('ATC11571', 0).text: The biofilm elimination rate was 58.87 % after exposure to MIC AgNPs.

('ATC12222', 1).text: Up to 90 % of preformed biofilms of S. aureus and E. coli were destroyed by OAMNPs and APTMS-MNPs.

('ATC13919', 0).text: This anti -E. coli capacity of AG + CO-coated MX-loaded MSNs was brought out in an in vivo rabbit model of osteomyelitis where the nanosystem was able to eradicate more than 90 % of the bacterial load within the infected bone.

('ATC14549', 0).text: At the con-centration of 60 ug mL-1, its inhibition rate against the growth of biofilm was 86 %, and elimination rate against biofilm reached 76 %.

('ATC15916', 0).text: E coli-336 and MRSA-1 strains at their MICs (1500 and 1000 ug ml-1 sharply reduced the biofilm production to 51 % and 24 %.

('ATC17569', 0).text: Moreover, protein-corona and antibiofilm activity are evident from numerous studies including DLS and AFM (e.g. reduction of the roughness of biofilm > 90 %).

('ATC18937', 0).text: The Ni NC coating significantly reduced E. coli attachment compared to a soluble nickel coating and reduced E. coli biomass area by 61 % compared to uncoated glass.

('ATC21133', 0).text: Moreover, the viability reduction of 60 % in S. aureus biofilms and 70 % in P. aeruginosa biofilms were obtained after three hours of irradiation with white light and amoxi@AuNP.

('ATC21275', 0).text: The antibiofilm inhibition percentages of free nisin and N-PVA-R-PLGA NPs were 28 % and 72 %, respectively.

('ATC22756', 0).text: Furthermore, biofilms formed by E. coli, S. aureus and P. aeruginosa PAO1 were maximally inhibited at 10 ug mL-1 BiVO4/g-C3N4 to a maximum of 67, 56 and 56 %, respectively.

('ATC25638', 1).text: The most correlated compound, identified as betulinic acid (BA), inhibited bispecies biofilms regardless of the three tested couples of strains (ATCC strains: > 40 % inhibition, clinical isolates: approximate to 27 % inhibition), confirming its antibiofilm interest.

('ATC31209', 0).text: Bio-fabricated TiO2-NPs reduced biofilm formation in the selected strains by 22 - 70 % at tested sub-MICs.

('ATC33406', 0).text: In vitro antimicrobial test with S. aureus, E. coli, P. aeruginosa, P. mirabilis, C. albicans microbes under dynamic conditions revealed that the microbial growth was hampered by 85 % compared with unmodified PDMS.

('ATC39588', 0).text: Further, the biofilm eradication efficiency was confirmed by 24-well polystyrene method with 24 h time duration and the result of 1000 mg mL-1 were shown 92 % and 94 % alteration against biofilm producing E. coli and P. mirabilis at 600 nm O.D using spectrophotometer.

('ATC48867', 0).text: The biofilm inhibition rates of the composites were determined, where the highest biofilm inhibition against S. aureus and P. aeruginosa was recorded for NC-Ag NPs as 63.85 % and 81.20 %, respectively.

('ATC50092', 0).text: The com-posite microswimmers displayed excellent antibacterial activity against S. aureus biofilm with an efficiency as high as 86.94 %.

('ATC50876', 0).text: 4-Nitro, 4-chloro, and 4-fluoro CNMA at >= 150 ug ml-1 significantly inhibited biofilm formation by 94 - 99 %.
